SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A procedure involving irradiation of a specific, limited area of the skin.
A procedure involving irradiation of the whole lung while the heart is covered and protected from radiation exposure.
A procedure involving irradiation of a single lung.
A procedure involving irradiation of the whole body either before or after irradiation at a focal site.
A procedure involving irradiation of the entire abdominal region.
A procedure involving irradiation of the whole body followed by bone marrow transplant.
SKOS_CONCEPT.notation: TOTAL BODY IRRADIATION PLUS BONE MARROW TRANSPLANT
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Total Body Irradiation Plus Bone Marrow Transplant

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A procedure involving irradiation of the whole body while a proportion of bone marrow is not irradiated, i.e., shielded or removed from field.
SKOS_CONCEPT.notation: TOTAL BODY IRRADIATION WITH BONE MARROW NOT IRRADIATED
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Total Body Irradiation with Bone Marrow Not Irradiated

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A procedure involving irradiation of the whole body.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: Bilateral Lungs Irradiation;Right and Left Lung Irradiation;TLI;Total Lung Irradiation;Whole Thorax Lung Irradiation;WLI;WTLI
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A procedure involving irradiation of the whole lung.
